datasets.name: bde2a186
datasets.query:
SELECT
*,
date_diff(current_timestamp(),last_altered) AS days_since_last_alter,
date_diff(current_timestamp(), latest_read_timestamp) AS days_since_last_read,
date_diff(current_timestamp(), created) AS days_since_creation,
CASE WHEN days_since_last_alter > :table_days_alerted_threshold::integer THEN 'STALE - READS' ELSE 'FINE' END AS is_stale_writes_flag,
CASE WHEN days_since_last_read > :table_days_read_threshold::integer THEN 'STALE - READS' ELSE 'FINE' END AS is_stale_reads_flag
FROM main.table_health_advisor.all_table_details
WHERE table_catalog NOT IN ('__databricks_internal', 'system', 'samples')
AND table_schema NOT IN ('__dlt_materialization_schema', 'information_schema')

datasets.name: f6ba73ba
datasets.query:
SELECT CONCAT(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) AS full_table_name, 

-- % of table with zombie storage
CASE 
    WHEN total_storage_gb = 0 THEN 0 
    ELSE (dead_storage_gb / total_storage_gb)*100
END AS percent_of_table_with_dead_storage,


-- % of table with zombie storage
CASE 
    WHEN table_file_counts = 0 THEN 0 
    ELSE (total_storage_gb / table_file_counts) * 1024
END AS average_file_size_mb,


-- staleness threshold for optimize
CASE WHEN days_since_last_optimize > :optimize_threshold_days THEN 'STALE OPTIMIZE' ELSE 'FINE' END AS is_stale_optimize,
-- staleness threshold for vacuum
CASE WHEN days_since_last_vacuum > :vacuum_threshold_days THEN 'STALE VACUUM' ELSE 'FINE' END AS is_stale_vacuum,
ts.*
-- Flag for yes/no 'Is Table In Good Health'
/*
 does not have NO layout strategy
 not stale optimize
 not stale vacuum
 has stats
*/
, CASE WHEN ts.table_layout_type != 'No Layout Defined' AND is_stale_optimize = 'FINE' AND is_stale_vacuum = 'FINE' AND ts.stats_status != 'No Statistics'
    THEN 'Good Health'
    ELSE 'Missing Steps'
    END AS good_health_status,


-- Flag for yes/no 'Is Table In Ideal Health'
/*
 Has clustered keys
 not stale optimize
 not stale vacuum
 has table & column stats
 predictive optimization is enabled - optional
*/

CASE WHEN ts.table_layout_type = 'Clustered' AND is_stale_optimize = 'FINE' AND is_stale_vacuum = 'FINE' AND ts.stats_status = 'Table & Column Statistics'
    THEN 'Great Health'
    WHEN good_health_status = 'Good Health' 
    THEN 'Good Health'
    ELSE 'Missing Steps'
    END AS great_health_status,
CASE WHEN good_health_status = 'Good Health' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS good_health_flag,
CASE WHEN great_health_status = 'Great Health' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS great_health_flag,
CASE WHEN good_health_status = 'Missing Steps' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS bad_health_flag,

filter(SPLIT(CONCAT(COALESCE( CASE WHEN ts.table_layout_type = 'No Layout Defined' THEN 'Define a layout - ideally cluster keys' END, ''), ',', 
        COALESCE( CASE WHEN is_stale_optimize != 'FINE' THEN 'Schedule Optimize More Frequently'END, ''), ',',
        COALESCE( CASE WHEN is_stale_vacuum != 'FINE' THEN 'Schedule Vacuum More Frequently'END, ''), ',',
         COALESCE( CASE WHEN ts.stats_status = 'No Statistics' THEN 'Calculate table & column stats' END, '')
         ), ','), x -> length(x) > 1) AS health_plan
-- TO DO
-- Add recommended steps in a list 
-- If clustered + predictive optimization --> great health
FROM main.table_health_advisor.table_state ts

widget.name: 430972fe
widget.textbox_spec:
# Table Health Advisor

This advisor aims to show health and statistics of your tables across your system. There are 2 primary sections: 
1. Section 1 - General Table info - across ALL Unity Catalog Tables. 
2. Section 2 - Table Health Deep Dive - this is based on a specifically scoped script that gets deep table statistics for review. Users must define the scope this script monitors to put new schemas into it. 
-----

widget.name: 2d3a3f97
widget.textbox_spec:
## Table Stats Deep Dive (Scoped Tables only)
----
